page.title: 14ST.MARY THE VIRGIN (CHURCH)
page.content:
Parish church for the whole area between Malden & Epsom, St.Mary's is a beautiful 12th_century chapel. It is first mentioned in the{Merton Priory} records for 1174_89.
{When the new diocese of}Guildford{ {was created in the 1930's, St.Mary's {was separated from its partner church {of Malden, thus enacting a wish {expressed by govt. surveyors in the {1600's. One of the reasons given by {the old ,survey was that}"the waies between this & Mauldon"{were}"extreame foule & impassable".{ { { }Much of the land tied to St.Mary's was seized by the Crown during the{ {Reformation.}Edward VI's commissioners sold off the church's ornaments, the resulting 8 shillings being used to repair Moor Lane.
